trans-unit.source: Manages the view state of ASP.NET server controls, including pages.
This class cannot be inherited.
View state for a page or control is the cumulative property values, or view, of that page or control.
You can access this class through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Controls can also store essential state information in control state, but that information is not stored as a StateBag object.
This class is the primary storage mechanism for all HTML and Web server controls.
It stores attribute/value pairs as strings associated with the control.
It tracks changes to these attributes only after the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.OnInit%2A> method is executed for a page request, and saves the changes to the page's or control's view state.
This class implements a dictionary, and you can add items to it or remove items from it as you would any dictionary object.
For more information about data collections, such as dictionaries, see [Collections and Data Structures](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> class.
This is the default constructor for this class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> class that allows stored state values to be case-insensitive.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to ignore case; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Adds a new <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> object to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
If the item already exists in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object, this method updates the value of the item.
The attribute name for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref>.
The value of the item to add to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref>.
Returns a <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> that represents the object added to view state.
Removes all items from the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
Gets the number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
The number of items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref>.
Returns an enumerator that iterates over all the key/value pairs of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> objects stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
The enumerator to iterate through the state bag.

Checks a <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> object stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object to evaluate whether it has been modified since the call to <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.TrackViewState%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This method also returns `false` if the `key` parameter does not exist in the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object.
The key of the item to check.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the item has been modified; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the value of an item stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
Using this member is the simplest way to save and retrieve view-state values for a control or a page.
If an item is not already stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object when you set this property, its key/value pair is added to the collection.
If you set this property to `null` before the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.TrackViewState%2A> method is called on an item, it is removed from the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object.
Otherwise, when you set this property to `null` the key is saved to allow tracking of the item's view state.
The key for the item.
The specified item in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
Gets a collection of keys representing the items in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
These keys are the names of the control properties.
For example, if you created a `BGColor` property on a `Table` control that you customized, a `BGColor` entry is created in this collection representing that property on your `Table` control.
These keys correspond to the names of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateItem> objects stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> collection for the current page or server control.
You can iterate over this collection using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag.GetEnumerator%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The collection of keys.
Removes the specified key/value pair from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
The item to remove.

Sets the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object as well as the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection.Dirty*> property of each of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> objects contained by it.
The SetDirty method is used to force the collection and its contents to be serialized during a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to mark the state of the collection and its items as modified; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Sets the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection.Dirty*> property for the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> object in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
The SetItemDirty method is used to prevent or force state management of specific properties, represented by <xref:System.Web.UI.StateItem> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> collection.
The key that identifies which <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> to set.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to mark the state of the item as modified; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.CopyTo%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array> that is the destination of the elements copied from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
The <xref:System.Array> must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> to use as the key of the element to add.
The <xref:System.Object> to use as the value of the element to add.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Contains%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
The key to locate in the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> contains an element with the key; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.IsFixedSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object has a fixed size; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.IsReadOnly%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Item%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
The key of the element to get.
The element with the specified key.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary.Remove*>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> interface.
The key of the element to remove.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Gets a value indicating whether state changes are being tracked.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> is marked to save changes to its state; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Restores the previously saved view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.

This method restores view-state information for the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object from a previous page request that was saved by the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag.System%23Web%23UI%23IStateManager%23SaveViewState%2A> method.
This method is primarily used by control developers.
You can override this method to control how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
An object that represents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> state to restore.
Saves the changes to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object since the time the page was posted back to the server.
This method is primarily used by control developers.
View state is the accumulation of the values of a server control's properties.
These values are automatically placed in the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property, which is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> class.
This property's value is then persisted to a string object after the save state stage of the server control life cycle.
For more information, see [NIB: ASP.NET Web Server Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e18eb2f2-cf00-47ae-b1a1-dfc188a6dea1).
When view state is saved, this string object is returned to the client as a variable that is stored in an HTML `Hidden` element.
When you author custom server controls, you can improve efficiency by overriding this method and modifying your server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ViewState%2A> property.

For more information, see [NIB: ASP.NET Web Server Controls](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/e18eb2f2-cf00-47ae-b1a1-dfc188a6dea1) and [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
The object that contains the changes to the view state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref>.

If there are no changes, or there are no <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateItem"></xref> elements in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref>, this method returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Causes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object to track changes to its state so that it can be persisted across requests.
Gets a collection of the view-state values stored in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
This is a collection that contains the values for all the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateItem> objects in the specified page or control.
You can iterate through these values by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag.GetEnumerator%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The collection of view-state values.
